intro: Fimbristylis nigrobrunnea, commonly known as black-brown false rice, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikelets that are often brownish in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in marshy areas or along the edges of water bodies. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
